<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><Highlight kind="comment">//======----------- WindowScheduler.cpp - window scheduler -------------======//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// An implementation of the Window Scheduling software pipelining algorithm.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The concept of the window algorithm was first unveiled in Steven Muchnick&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// book, &quot;Advanced Compiler Design And Implementation&quot;, and later elaborated</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// upon in Venkatraman Govindaraju&#39;s report, &quot;Implementation of Software</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Pipelining Using Window Scheduling&quot;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The window algorithm can be perceived as a modulo scheduling algorithm with a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stage count of 2 It boasts a higher scheduling success rate in targets with</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// severe resource conflicts when compared to the classic Swing Modulo</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Scheduling (SMS) algorithm. To align with the LLVM scheduling framework, we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have enhanced the original window algorithm. The primary steps are as</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// follows:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 Instead of duplicating the original MBB twice as mentioned in the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// literature, we copy it three times, generating TripleMBB and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// corresponding TripleDAG.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 We establish a scheduling window on TripleMBB and execute list scheduling</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// within it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3 After multiple list scheduling, we select the best outcome and expand it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into the final scheduling result.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To cater to the needs of various targets, we have developed the window</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scheduler in a form that is easily derivable. We recommend employing this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// algorithm in targets with severe resource conflicts, and it can be utilized</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// either before or after the Register Allocator (RA).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The default implementation provided here is before RA. If it is to be used</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// after RA, certain critical algorithm functions will need to be derived.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;WINDOWSCHEDULER&#95;H</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;WINDOWSCHEDULER&#95;H</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machineregisterinfo-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineRegisterInfo.h</a>&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinescheduler-h">llvm/CodeGen/MachineScheduler.h</a>&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/scheduledaginstrs-h">llvm/CodeGen/ScheduleDAGInstrs.h</a>&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13">WindowSchedulingFlag</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a928a9fffc4999e7b94132985c714f0e1"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a928a9fffc4999e7b94132985c714f0e1">WS&#95;Off</a>,  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/// Turn off window algorithm.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13ae768da8e96f8d52eebd6fa9e2cf40ad3"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13ae768da8e96f8d52eebd6fa9e2cf40ad3">WS&#95;On</a>,   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/// Use window algorithm after SMS algorithm fails.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a14f36bdb57b5840e63c6fae657f025c5"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a72daa22c9a997fec8618158cad8f5e13a14f36bdb57b5840e63c6fae657f025c5">WS&#95;Force</a> </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/// Use window algorithm instead of SMS algorithm.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The main class in the implementation of the target independent window</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">/// scheduler.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a588faf8e1f126dc258d357b045595407"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineregisterinfo">MachineRegisterInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a588faf8e1f126dc258d357b045595407">MRI</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// To innovatively identify the dependencies between MIs across two trips, we</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// construct a DAG for a new MBB, which is created by copying the original</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MBB three times. We refer to this new MBB as &#39;TripleMBB&#39; and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// corresponding DAG as &#39;TripleDAG&#39;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the dependencies are more than two trips, we avoid applying window</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// algorithm by identifying successive phis in the old MBB.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aabfa4ddad621932351b720f8162030e8"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;ScheduleDAGInstrs&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aabfa4ddad621932351b720f8162030e8">TripleDAG</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// OriMIs keeps the MIs removed from the original MBB.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aed4001b80ceaef38d700764e9934e054"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aed4001b80ceaef38d700764e9934e054">OriMIs</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TriMIs keeps the MIs of TripleMBB, which is used to restore TripleMBB.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#afbe266c442e9313e05ebffb703c2bd36"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#afbe266c442e9313e05ebffb703c2bd36">TriMIs</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TriToOri keeps the mappings between the MI clones in TripleMBB and their</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// original MI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a7e8c400b0b728b6ec230f0b487c6af44"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, MachineInstr &#42;&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a7e8c400b0b728b6ec230f0b487c6af44">TriToOri</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// OriToCycle keeps the mappings between the original MI and its issue cycle.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a54d52175d63bed9f3b0bd9f6317e023e"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/densemap">DenseMap&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, int&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a54d52175d63bed9f3b0bd9f6317e023e">OriToCycle</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SchedResult keeps the result of each list scheduling, and the format of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the tuple is &lt;MI pointer, Cycle, Stage, Order ID&gt;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#af3f7938e6818ec29f907451091b7fdad"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;std::tuple&lt;MachineInstr &#42;, int, int, int&gt;</a>, 256&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#af3f7938e6818ec29f907451091b7fdad">SchedResult</a>;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SchedPhiNum records the number of phi in the original MBB, and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// scheduling starts with MI after phis.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SchedInstrNum records the MIs involved in scheduling in the original MBB,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// excluding debug instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BestII and BestOffset record the characteristics of the best scheduling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result and are used together with SchedResult as the final window</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// scheduling result.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a6fba85773a0cf15056c4263ac69dbc80"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a6fba85773a0cf15056c4263ac69dbc80">BestII</a> = UINT&#95;MAX;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a67690feca344d36167d2f65f71653f4e"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#a67690feca344d36167d2f65f71653f4e">BestOffset</a> = 0;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BaseII is the II obtained when the window offset is SchedPhiNum. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// offset is the initial position of the sliding window.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aaffbb1654d149fc4b75f0793c03cd398"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/windowscheduler/#aaffbb1654d149fc4b75f0793c03cd398">BaseII</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
